intro: Spermacoce bequaertii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom at night. The plant has opposite, simple leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. The flowers emit a sweet scent to attract nocturnal pollinators such as moths.
